Reviews.Title: “should be condemned”
Reviews.Author: unsatisfied35805
Reviews.Content: This motel should be condemned. We checked into the motel and immediately checked-out upon finding a bullet hole in the window and blood splattered on the box spring and mattress. The motel is not in a safe area. The room also smelled of smoke. Further, the door to our room was difficult to open and needed a good elbow to open. The handle to the faucet broke off when we turned the water on and there was a leak in the ceiling. I would not recommend this motel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Gross”
Reviews.Author: zshwisconsin
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness we only stayed here one night. When we walked in, the room's pungent smoke smell hit us. It was clear that the room had been recently smoked in...ok, it's a smoking room, fine. However, the bathroom was filthy. I had to laugh at the little 'sanitized for your protection' band that was placed on the toilet seat - as soon as I lifted the seat I was greeted with a nasty toilet and several 'questionable' hairs around the rim. GROSS. There was visible dirt on the counter top, and more 'questionable' hairs all over the floor of the bathroom, and visible mold on the ceiling of the bathroom. The towels were clearly ancient, threadbare and STAINED. They did not seem clean. If you have the means, I highly recommend staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff - poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerjerDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: If I was to base the review on the staff alone, it would get top marks. But I cannot ignore the dirt of the hotel (motel) and the general conition of the property. It was located ok for me as I arrived into the bus station beside it, but with regard to getting around, it was impossible to use public transport as it never arrived! I was left walking 2 mile through neighbourhoods that I didn't know trying to get back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs security and a lot of maintanance.”
Reviews.Author: zekewolf-11
Reviews.Content: This motel is not in a very good area. We went for a walk around the grounds one evening and we were suprised by a man who came running at us yelling. We walked into the lobby thinking that we would be ok there but were amazed that he walked up to the front desk and told them "I want to talk to them" and was allowed to follow us down the corridor. He then said he needed money as his car had broken down 2 blocks away. It was obvious to everyone that we were trying to distance ourselves from him and a confrontation ensued. He finally left empty handed after we directed him back to the front desk, but who needs this on holiday? Later we went for another walk and there he was waiting in an old car for some other poor sod to walk in. He saw us and round two was on. We decided to forego any more walks. Why was he allowed to park in the grounds let alone follow us down the corridor? They advertised a continental breakfast but there was no breakfast except a couple of rolls of doubtful origin, and these were gone before we got to them.(they were not replaced) there was not even toast. Nothing. Even the fruit juce containers were empty and this was at 7am! The maintanace? Yes we had a fridge but it was in a death throw. It wheezed and gasped so much we had to turn it off at night. The bath was cracked and the crack was covered with sealer. We even had a cockroach wander by to keep us entertained. On the last morning I checked under the bed and was amused to find a large piece of wood under the centre of the bed supporting it. The place itself could be ok with some maintanace. But it does need security. It was reasonably cheap but we would have gladly paid more somewhere else especially to have breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I initially expected”
Reviews.Author: Culture_Lover
Reviews.Content: My Memphis-bound plane was landing in Little Rock because the Memphis airport was closed while a storm passed through. I was not likely to make my 40-minute connection there, so I called my husband, who checked for hotels near the airport and found this one with a low price and decent ratings. When he saw that my other plane had taken off after Memphis re-opened, he booked me this hotel, envisioning a mad scramble for rooms in Memphis. I was a bit dismayed when I originally arrived, as the lobby is locked and the neighborhood is airport/industrial, but the room was comfortable, I have wireless internet (my room is near the lobby), and there was even a very minimal breakfast. For $5 each way, there's a shuttle to the airport. I might have done better had I booked through the "reduced rate" line that the airline gave me, but this is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: miem31990
Reviews.Content: Bathroom fixtures and shower nozzle were moldy. Ants crawling around on bathroom counter. Neighborhood was kind of scary.

Reviews.Title: “Yes It is Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: peppertree5706
Reviews.Content: All I want in Memphis is an inexpensive place to stay. The location is good and on the coldest night last winter (16 degrees) the heat was toasty warm in the room. This is not the Ritz Carlton, but I did not expect it to be. The room even came with a small refrigerator, though it had someone's else's food in it. I am going to Memphis this week, and since the casinos in Tunica, MS are flooded and closed, I am happy to come back to Knight's Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: Stormynark
Reviews.Content: A friend and I made a 3 day trip to Memphis at the first of August. We stayed at the Knight's Inn Airport. Since we were staying 2 nights, we got a cheaper rate. The hotel was very clean and the people were friendly and helpful. We were within 15 mins of everything we wanted to do. The pool looked great even though we never got the chance to use it. The breakfast was not anything special, just your typical rolls and cereal to eat with orange juice and coffee to drink. I don't eat breakfast so that didn't really bother me. My friend had cereal and a roll with a cup of coffee. There were refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms. Did not use the micorwave but the frig worked good. I kept cokes in there and they got very cold very quickly. I heard 1 airplane go over the first night. After that, I didn't hear any or notice them at all. If you are looking for a place to sleep and shower at a great price close to attractions, I would recommend this hotel and we plan on going back and we will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dnncampbell
Reviews.Content: Simple hotel, had small refrigerator and microwave in room. Didn't have Coffee Pot, or Hair Dryer. In process of remodeling. Doing a good job. Wish Continental Breakfast had hard boiled eggs or something with protein.

Reviews.Title: “Just pay the extra 5 bucks and get a decent hotel!! Don't stay here!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamjam12
Reviews.Content: This was far most the worst hotel I've ever stay at in my LIFE! There is no alarm clock, you have to pay 25 cent for a LOCAL call, you have to put a $5 deposit to use the iron. I should've not been cheap and try to save a couple of bucks...Please just pay the 5 bucks more for a decent hotel. I'm never going to come back here! And another thing, it is filthy, my bedspread smelled like a wet dog! The tub was dirty, we had no tissue, and the towels still had dirt spots..... Maintenance PLEASE! JUST DON'T GO!

Reviews.Title: “It was a ok experience For the Price”
Reviews.Author: evoman574
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at this motel. The room was average even though the hotel turns down the water heater at night. I called the front desk for towels for the room after hours and could not get any towels.. There is a Night Club at the Hotel it was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Knights Inn Airport, Memphis, TN - Has maintence problems”
Reviews.Author: KansasJack1
Reviews.Content: Knights Inn Airport, 2949 Airways Blvd, Memphis, TN is a low maintenance motel. The room we had, 174, was in need of major repair. The ceiling had water stains, the doorway was crumbling, the toilet rocked back and forth, Amenities were few. Lighting in the room was the bare essential to be able to see. Several bulbs were burnt out. During the week we spent there, we had to ask for clean towels, soap and tissue, even though the management came in each day we were out to make the beds. The advertised "continental breakfast" was a joke. A few prepackaged "Little Debbie" rolls, some apple juice, powdered orange drink and coffee. The furnishings in the breakfast area were sparse. The advertised "pool" appeared to be nice, however it was closed the entire week. The day we departed the staff of the motel was out there painting the area around the pool with the spray blowing into the pool. Areas outside were crumbling due to water damage, with loose cement on the underside of the stairwell and several other places on the building to include the front of the motel. Since the motel is located by the airport, several blocks away, it was somewhat noisy with the airplanes going overhead, especially at night. It appeared that there was a lack of installation in the walls and ceiling.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here, Period!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fishfry7
Reviews.Content: This place is nasty, stinks, and is run down. Oh, did I mention the short hairs on the bed sheets or the dried blood in the sink or the busted light in the bathroom or the bathroom door that would not close or the room door i had to push with my shoulder to open and slam to shut. Stains on the walls and carpet. Oh, these were good rooms we looked at 4 rooms. the pool was closed down. Why did i stay? had to or lose my money , payed for room online thru hotwire and was garrunteed a nice quality hotel but no refund. will never do that again. Go ahead and spend an extra 10.00 and stay at a better hotel you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Can't believe I stayed here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherrence
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst hotel experience we've ever had!! We had to make an emergency trip to Alabama from Missouri because if a death in the family, we chose this hotel because of the fact it was pet friendly. After being cooped up in the car with a 3 yr old and a 15 month for 6 hours we were ready to get out and strech our legs and run around! When we got there the boys were so glad to be out of the car. We took their shoes off first big mistake! The 15 month old's feet were BLACK in 5 mins! He can play out side barefoot all day and never reach that level of dirtyness. When we were unloading our car a guy came up to us with a "beater" stick and said someone just tried jumping him!!! We were to emotionaly and physically exhausted to go find another place but made a vowel that we would tell everyone not to stay in this HOTEL it was nasty dirty we can't believed we stayed here!! Thank God it was only night, and that He protected us all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and very dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Cheyenne470
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Knights Inn at 2949 Airways Blvd., Memphis, TN 38131, US from 10 January-13 January 2007 and was horribly disappointed. I have stayed in spare rooms in bars in third world countries and hostels that made the movie of the same name look tame and this was one of my top 10 worst experiences. The rooms are horrible. The locks do not work (one is actually missing [the lock where you flip a long loop bolted to the doorframe over a ball on a rod affixed to the door itself was missing the loop]) on the front door (the peep hole did not work either) and the bathroom door does not close at all. The floors and walls are stained with some brownish red substance and dotted with mold and other random stains and tears. The mattress and box springs are soaked in some red substance (and I do mean soaked). The sheets, towels, washcloths, pillows and comforter are threadbare and stained. The furniture and electronics are from the 70s and broken (the tables sway if anything is set on them and the remote is missing batteries and a battery cover). The mirrors are chipped. The outlets will not hold plugs and shock you if you touch them. Most of the lamps and fixtures that do work do not have light bulbs and the ones that do have no covering. There are used condoms in the dresser drawers. The shower curtain is covered in mold. The bathroom walls and tub are covered with mold, mildew and that reddish brown stain. The toilet does not flush unless you hold down the handle the entire time. The knob to the sink has to be held on in order to use the water. There is no drain cover but there is a toothbrush lid in the drain. I had to purchase bedding, towels and cleaning supplies at 2 in the morning after driving 6 hours non stop in order to sleep. Lastly, there is no security (evidenced by the fact that my car was broken into in the parking lot and my GPS, iPod, digital compass, coat and iPod dock were stolen, the fact that on two separate occasions someone attempted to jimmy open my door while I was inside and I was followed by a gentleman whenever I left my room for ice or to go to my car). I checked out as soon as my conference was over as I was actually frightened (it was in nice enough area, it was just this hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly, but old and cheap”
Reviews.Author: Trukin_Lady_n_Wife
Reviews.Content: The inn is definitely old, but not dirty. They have designated pet rooms, but the wifi doesn't reach those areas which was inconvenient. The room smelled dingy and damp. The wallpaper was peeling. The furniture was stained and scuffed. They had truckers discount, but wouldn't give us the weekly rate since we had a pet. For an advertised pet friendly hotel chain, we weren't treated the same as other customers. No weekly rate, no wifi. Also there's a bar on property, but its a local joint that seems a bit rough. We discovered the Studio 6 was nearby for just as cheap but nicer, and moved there.

Reviews.Title: “Umm...Cheap price, but very dirty.”
Reviews.Author: kochamtraveling
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I am all about saving a few bucks and "you get what you paid for" applies to this hotel. Room 163 (if it represents the entire facility) is seriously in bad shape. Stains are all over the walls, carpet, and bathroom. Maintenance painted the ceiling in the bathroom and didn't clean up; there were drip stains all the way down the shower wall. The bathroom wall is peeling away from itself, probably becasue of the humidity and the bathroom fan not working. An old sticky phone book was stuck to the bottom of the night stand. House keeping probably didn't vaccum; there was cigarette ash scattered throughout the floor. Found a dried snot on the bedsheet, Ewww! The television set is color, but dates back to the early 80's. Keep your shoes on AT ALL TIMES, unless you are asking for trouble. I didn't complain to the staff because I didn't see it being necessary. I mean what would do, put me in another room. I thought I'd spare myself the aggravation because I'm certain that the entire property is in bad shape. Oh, and the pool, well that was closed. I didn't even ask why. I would not have swam in it anyway. So with a cheap price come very poor accommodations. You decide for yourself. Save traveling everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Room ever, period!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I knew this was a 2-star, economy hotel. We just wanted an inexpensive, clean bed to sleep in on our way home from New Orleans. No alarm clock, no hairdryer, etc...but we weren't expecting those things anyway. Like I said, we wanted to sleep, shower, and be on our way. However...this place is DIRTY. There were two armchairs in the room that looked like the filthiest person had been sweating on the armchairs for ages- the arm and headrests were absolutely black! My goodness, just throw them out. The carpet was so stained, I did not remove my shoes at all, except to get into bed, which was decent. We had a couple of eight-legged friends in the bathroom, but we kept them in hopes that they would eat the gnats. It's a shame because this is a property with good location and a lot of potential, it seems that the basic upkeep has been neglected for quite a while. Still, I have been in other 2-star properties that were no frills, but CLEAN. Next time I'm in Memphis, I'll spring for something else.

HotelInfo.Name: Knights Inn Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2949 Airways Boulevard, Memphis, TN 38116
